note: I could have been a contender. I have no country to fight for; my country is the earth; I am a citizen of the world. A walking contradiction, partly truth and partly fiction. I wish I could wear a rainbow every day and tell the world that everything's OK. Just trying to make an honest buck. Enough to keep body and soul apart. Freedom is just another word for noting left to lose. All I want is one break. Which is not my neck. Cast a cold eye on life, on death; horseman, pass by.
